soc.client

Class SOCBoardPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • soc.client.SOCBoardPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    class SOCBoardPanel
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    This is a component that can display a Settlers of Catan Board. It can be used in an applet or an application.

    Graphics:

    This panel loads its hex texture images and dice result numbers from a directory named images in the same directory as this class. Everything else is drawn as lines, circles, polygons, and text. If the user's preferred set of hex images changes after creating a SOCBoardPanel, call reloadBoardGraphics(Component) and flushBoardLayoutAndRepaint().

    The main drawing methods are drawBoardEmpty(Graphics) for hexes and ports, and drawBoard(Graphics) for placed pieces like settlements and the robber. The board background color is set in SOCPlayerInterface. Since all areas outside the board boundaries are filled with water hex tiles, this color is only a fallback; it's briefly visible at window creation while the hexes are loading and rendering.

    Interaction:

    When the mouse is over the game board, a tooltip shows information such as a hex's resource, a piece's owner, a port's trading ratio, or the number under the robber. See hoverTip.

    During game play, moving the mouse over the board shows ghosted roads, settlements, cities, and ships at locations the player can build. See: hilight, SOCBoardPanel.BoardToolTip.hoverRoadID. Right-click to build, or use the SOCBuildingPanel's buttons.

    Before the game begins, the boardpanel is full of water hexes. You can show a short message text of 1 or 2 lines by calling setSuperimposedText(String, String).

    During game play, you can show a short 1-line message text in the top-center part of the panel by calling setSuperimposedTopText(String).

    Scaling and rotation:

    Based on board size in hexes, this panel's minimum width and height in pixels is getMinimumSize(). To set its size, call setSize(int, int) or setBounds(int, int, int, int); these methods will set a flag to rescale board graphics if needed. If the game has 6 players but not SOCGame.hasSeaBoard, the board is also rotated 90 degrees clockwise.

    Pixel coordinates can be transformed between actual (scaled/rotated) and unscaled/un-rotated "internal" pixel coordinates with scaleFromActual(int), scaleToActual(int), #scaleFromActual(int[]), scaleToActual(int[]).

    The panel can in some cases be stretched wider than the board requires, with a built-in x-margin: SOCPlayerInterface.doLayout() checks for the necessary conditions.

    Sequence for loading, rendering, and drawing images:

    • Constructor calls loadImages(Component, boolean) and rescaleCoordinateArrays()
    • Layout manager calls setSize(..) or setBounds(..), which calls rescaleBoard(int, int)
    • rescaleBoard(int, int) scales hex images, calls renderBorderedHex(Image, Color) and renderPortImages() into image buffers to use for redrawing the board
    • paintComponent(Graphics) calls drawBoard(Graphics)
    • First call to drawBoard(..) calls drawBoardEmpty(Graphics) which renders into a buffer image
    • drawBoard(..) draws the placed pieces over the buffered board image from drawBoardEmpty(..)

    Scenario-specific board items:

    Some scenarios have special pieces, like SC_WOND's SOCFortress (tooltip text from keyed strings board.sc_piri.*) or SC_CLVI's Villages.
    Some scenarios draw colored diamonds at specific nodes or edges, to indicate things that are part of the scenarios. Hovering over a diamond should show a tooltip for its purpose:
    • SC_CLVI: Yellow SOCVillages, each with a remaining-cloth count number. Tooltip text from board.sc_clvi.village.
    • SC_FTRI: Yellow Dev Card "gift" edges, green SVP "gift" edges. Tooltip text from board.edge.devcard, board.edge.svp.
    • SC_WOND: Node Sets N1 - N3 where player cannot initially place, or where a building is required to start building a certain Wonder. Various colors. Tooltip text from board.nodelist._SC_WOND.N1 - .N3.

      • PANELX

        public static final int PANELX
        Default size of the whole panel, in unscaled internal pixels. This constant may not reflect the current game board's minimum size: In board-internal coordinates, use panelMinBW and panelMinBH instead. For minimum acceptable size in on-screen pixels, call getMinimumSize() instead of using PANELX and PANELY directly. For actual current size in screen pixels, see scaledPanelW scaledPanelH; If isRotated(), the minimum size swaps PANELX and PANELY. If 6-player board or Large/Sea Board, the minimum size is larger.

        Left/top margins for isLargeBoard are 0 for x, halfdeltaY for y.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PANELY

        public static final int PANELY
        Default size of the whole panel, in unscaled internal pixels. This constant may not reflect the current game board's minimum size: In board-internal coordinates, use panelMinBW and panelMinBH instead. For minimum acceptable size in on-screen pixels, call getMinimumSize() instead of using PANELX and PANELY directly. For actual current size in screen pixels, see scaledPanelW scaledPanelH; If isRotated(), the minimum size swaps PANELX and PANELY. If 6-player board or Large/Sea Board, the minimum size is larger.

        Left/top margins for isLargeBoard are 0 for x, halfdeltaY for y.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • is6player

        protected boolean is6player
        The board is configured for classic 6-player layout (and is isRotated); set in constructor by checking SOCBoard.getBoardEncodingFormat() <= SOCBoard.BOARD_ENCODING_6PLAYER and SOCGame.maxPlayers > 4.

        The entire coordinate system is land, except the rightmost hexes are unused (7D-DD-D7 row). The 6-player mode uses hexX_6pl instead of hexX_st for coordinates.

        When isLargeBoard, this field is false even if the game has 5 or 6 players. The is6player flag is about the hex layout on the board, not the number of players.

        Since:
        1.1.08
        See Also:
        inactiveHexNums, isLargeBoard

      • isLargeBoard

        protected final boolean isLargeBoard
        The board is configured Large-Board Format (up to 127x127, oriented like classic 4-player); set in constructor by checking SOCBoard.getBoardEncodingFormat(). The coordinate system is an arbitrary land/water mixture.

        When isLargeBoard, isRotated() is false even if the game has 5 or 6 players.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        is6player, portHexCoords

      • isRotated

        protected boolean isRotated
        The board is visually rotated 90 degrees clockwise (classic 6-player: game opt PL > 4) compared to its internal pixel coordinates. "Top" in board coords is "at right" in screen coords.

        Use this for rotation:

        • From internal to screen (cw): R(x, y) = (panelMinBH - y, x)
        • From screen to internal (ccw): R(x, y) = (y, panelMinBW - x)
        When the board is also scaled, go in this order:
        • Rotate clockwise, scale up, then add (panelMarginX, panelMarginY).
        • Subtract (panelMarginX, panelMarginY), scale down, then rotate counterclockwise.
        When calculating position at which to draw an image or polygon, remember that rotation changes which corner is considered (0,0), and the image is offset from that corner. (For example, drawHex(Graphics, int) subtracts HEXHEIGHT from x, after rotation but before scaling.)

        When isLargeBoard, isRotated is false even if the game has 5 or 6 players.

        Since:
        1.1.08
        See Also:
        isScaledOrRotated

      • isScaledOrRotated

        protected boolean isScaledOrRotated
        Convenience flag - The board is rotated and/or scaled up. Check both of those flags when transforming between screen coordinates and internal pixel coordinates. See isRotated for order of rotation/scaling/margin translation.
        Since:
        1.1.08

      • panelMinBW

        protected int panelMinBW
        panelMinBW and panelMinBH are the minimum width and height, in board-internal pixel coordinates (not rotated or scaled). Based on board's SOCBoard.getBoardWidth() and SOCBoard.getBoardHeight(), plus any top or left margin from the Visual Shift layout part "VS" passed into our constructor: panelShiftBX, panelShiftBY.

        Differs from static PANELX, PANELY for 6-player board and the large board.

        Differs from minSize because minSize takes isRotated into account.

        Rescaling formulas use scaledBoardW and unscaledBoardW instead of these fields, to avoid distortion from rotation or board size aspect ratio changes.

        Since:
        1.1.08

      • panelMinBH

        protected int panelMinBH
        panelMinBW and panelMinBH are the minimum width and height, in board-internal pixel coordinates (not rotated or scaled). Based on board's SOCBoard.getBoardWidth() and SOCBoard.getBoardHeight(), plus any top or left margin from the Visual Shift layout part "VS" passed into our constructor: panelShiftBX, panelShiftBY.

        Differs from static PANELX, PANELY for 6-player board and the large board.

        Differs from minSize because minSize takes isRotated into account.

        Rescaling formulas use scaledBoardW and unscaledBoardW instead of these fields, to avoid distortion from rotation or board size aspect ratio changes.

        Since:
        1.1.08

      • panelShiftBX

        protected int panelShiftBX
        Margin size, in board-internal pixels (not rotated or scaled), for the Visual Shift layout part ("VS") if any passed into our constructor. For actual-pixels size see panelMarginX, panelMarginY.

        For more info on "VS" see the "Added Layout Parts" section of BL.getAddedLayoutPart("VS")'s javadoc.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • panelShiftBY

        protected int panelShiftBY
        Margin size, in board-internal pixels (not rotated or scaled), for the Visual Shift layout part ("VS") if any passed into our constructor. For actual-pixels size see panelMarginX, panelMarginY.

        For more info on "VS" see the "Added Layout Parts" section of BL.getAddedLayoutPart("VS")'s javadoc.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • panelMarginX

        protected int panelMarginX
        Scaled (actual pixels) panel x-margin on left and y-margin on top, to center board visually if board's unscaled width is less than panelMinBW. Includes any Visual Shift (Added Layout Part "VS") from panelShiftBX, panelShiftBY.

        Methods like drawBoard(Graphics) and drawBoardEmpty(Graphics) will translate by panelMarginX before calling playing-piece methods like drawSettlement(Graphics, int, int, boolean, boolean), so those pieces' methods can ignore the panelMarginX value.

        Updated in rescaleBoard(int, int). Won't be negative if isRotated, which is used only with classic 6-player board.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • panelMarginY

        protected int panelMarginY
        Scaled (actual pixels) panel x-margin on left and y-margin on top, to center board visually if board's unscaled width is less than panelMinBW. Includes any Visual Shift (Added Layout Part "VS") from panelShiftBX, panelShiftBY.

        Methods like drawBoard(Graphics) and drawBoardEmpty(Graphics) will translate by panelMarginX before calling playing-piece methods like drawSettlement(Graphics, int, int, boolean, boolean), so those pieces' methods can ignore the panelMarginX value.

        Updated in rescaleBoard(int, int). Won't be negative if isRotated, which is used only with classic 6-player board.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • isScaled

        protected boolean isScaled
        The board is currently scaled up, larger than panelMinBW x panelMinBH pixels. Use scaleToActual(int), scaleFromActual(int), etc to convert between internal and actual screen pixel coordinates.

        When the board is also rotated, go in this order: Rotate clockwise, then scale up; Scale down, then rotate counterclockwise.

        When this flag is set true, also sets scaledAt. A copy of the static board graphic images will be rescaled to match the scaled-up size and stored in scaledHexes, scaledPorts, etc.

        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        isScaledOrRotated, scaledAt, rescaleBoard(int, int), isHexesAlwaysScaled

      • scaledAt

        protected long scaledAt
        Time of last request to resize and repaint, as returned by System.currentTimeMillis(). Used with scaledMissedImage.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        drawnEmptyAt

      • scaledMissedImage

        protected boolean scaledMissedImage
        Flag used while drawing a scaled board (isScaled or isHexesAlwaysScaled). If board size was recently changed, could be waiting for an image to resize. If it still hasn't appeared after 7 seconds, we'll give up and create a new one. (This can happen due to AWT bugs.) Set in drawHex(Graphics, int), checked in drawBoard(Graphics).
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        scaledHexFail, scaledAt, drawnEmptyAt

      • debugShowPotentials

        boolean[] debugShowPotentials
        For debugging, flags to show board and player potential/legal coordinate sets for client player. Sets flagged as shown are drawn in drawBoardEmpty(Graphics). Currently implemented only for the sea board layout (SOCBoardLarge).

        Stored in same order as piece types:

        • 0: Legal roads - yellow parallel lines
        • 1: Legal settlements - yellow squares
        • 2: Board boundaries - yellow rectangle (Legal cities has no set)
        • 3: Legal ships - yellow diamonds
        • 4: Potential roads - green parallel lines
        • 5: Potential settlements - green squares
        • 6: Potential cities - green larger squares
        • 7: Potential ships - green diamonds
        • 8: Land hexes - red round rects
        • 9: Nodes on land - red round rects

        Changed via setDebugShowPotentialsFlag(int, boolean, boolean) with SOCPlayerInterface debug command =*= show: n or =*= hide: n, where n is an index shown above or all.

        If player is null, shows for player 0.

        Has package-level visibility, for use by SOCPlayerInterface.updateAtPutPiece(int, int, int, boolean, int).

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        debugShowCoordsTooltip

      • buildReqTimerTask

        protected SOCBoardPanel.BoardPanelSendBuildTask buildReqTimerTask
        For right-click build popupMenu; used for fallback part of client-server-client communication of a build request. Created whenever right-click build request is sent to server.

        Is fallback for this usual sequence of calls:

        1. popupExpectingBuildRequest()
        2. SOCPlayerInterface.updateAtGameState()
        3. popupFireBuildingRequest()
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • robberGhostFill

        protected java.awt.Color[] robberGhostFill
        Cached colors, for use for robber's "ghost" (previous position) when moving the robber. Values are determined the first time the robber is ghosted on that type of tile. Index ranges from 0 to SOCBoard.max_robber_hextype.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        ColorSquare, drawRobber(Graphics, int, boolean, boolean)

      • robberGhostOutline

        Cached colors, for use for robber's "ghost" (previous position) when moving the robber. Values are determined the first time the robber is ghosted on that type of tile. Index ranges from 0 to SOCBoard.max_robber_hextype.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        ColorSquare, drawRobber(Graphics, int, boolean, boolean)

      • getMinimumSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getMinimumSize()
        Minimum required width and height, as determined by options and isRotated(). Ignores SOCPlayerInterface.displayScale.

        Minimum size is set in the constructor. On the classic 4-player and 6-player boards, the size is based on PANELX and PANELY. When SOCGame.hasSeaBoard, the size is based on SOCBoard.getBoardWidth() and .getBoardHeight() plus any positive optional SOCBoardLarge.getAddedLayoutPart("VS").

        Overrides:
        getMinimumSize in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Returns:
        minimum size
        See Also:
        getExtraSizeFromBoard(boolean)

      • getExtraSizeFromBoard

        public java.awt.Dimension getExtraSizeFromBoard(boolean doScale)
        Get the amount of our current width and height that comes from the board being larger than the standard 4-player board size. Compares SOCBoard.getBoardWidth(), SOCBoard.getBoardHeight() against BOARDWIDTH_VISUAL_MIN, BOARDHEIGHT_VISUAL_MIN. Adjusts for SOCBoardPanel padding constants and any space added by a positive optional SOCBoardLarge.getAddedLayoutPart("VS").
        Parameters:
        doScale - If true, the returned extra width & height are scaled screen pixels, not board-internal; calls scaleToActual(int)
        Returns:
        extra size in pixels, or (0, 0)
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • getScaledImageUp

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getScaledImageUp(java.awt.Image src,
                                                            int w,
                                                            int h)
        Scale up an image with decent quality. Convenience method to call instead of obsolete Image.getScaledInstance(int, int, int). Calls Graphics2D.drawImage (src, 0, 0, w, h, null) using RenderingHints.VALUE_INTERPOLATION_BICUBIC.

        For more info see the Java2D team blog 2007 post "The Perils of Image.getScaledInstance()" by ChrisAdamson.

        Parameters:
        src - Source image to scale up; assumes is transparent, not opaque.
        w - Scale up to this width
        h - Scale up to this height
        Returns:
        the scaled image
        Since:
        1.1.20

      • scaleToActual

        public void scaleToActual(int[] xa)
        Scale pixel-coordinate array from internal to actual screen-pixel coordinates. If not isScaled, do nothing.

        This method only scales; does not rotate if isRotated() or translate by panelMarginX or panelMarginY.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was scaleToActualX(x[]) and scaleToActualY(y[]).

        Parameters:
        xa - Int array to be scaled in place; each member is an x-coordinate or y-coordinate.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        scaleToActual(int), scaleCopyToActual(int[])

      • scaleToActual

        public final int scaleToActual(int x)
        Scale an x- or y-coordinate up from internal to actual screen-pixel coordinates. If not isScaled, return input.

        This method only scales up; does not rotate if isRotated() or translate by panelMarginX or panelMarginY.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was scaleToActualX(x) and scaleToActualY(y).

        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate or y-coordinate to be scaled
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        scaleFromActual(int), scaleToActual(int[])

      • scaleFromActual

        public final int scaleFromActual(int x)
        Scale an x- or y-coordinate down from actual-scaled to internal-scaled coordinates. If not isScaled, return input.

        This method only scales down; does not rotate if isRotated() or translate by panelMarginX or panelMarginY.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was scaleFromActualX(x) and scaleFromActualY(y).

        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate or y-coordinate to be scaled. Subtract panelMarginX or panelMarginY before calling.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        scaleToActual(int)

      • isScaled

        public boolean isScaled()
        Is the board currently scaled up, larger than PANELX x PANELY pixels? If so, use scaleToActual(int), scaleFromActual(int), etc to convert between internal and actual screen pixel coordinates.

        When the board is also isRotated(), see isRotated() javadoc for order of rotation/scaling/margin translation.

        Returns:
        Is the board scaled larger than default size?
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        isRotated()

      • isRotated

        public boolean isRotated()
        Is the board currently visually rotated 90 degrees clockwise compared to its internal pixel coordinates? If so, the minimum size swaps PANELX and PANELY.

        Use this for rotation:

        • From internal to screen (clockwise): R(x, y) = (internalHeight - y, x)
        • From screen to internal (counterclockwise): R(x, y) = (y, internalWidth - x)
        When the board is also isScaled(), go in this order:
        • Rotate clockwise, scale up, then add any margin.
        • Subtract any margin, scale down, then rotate counterclockwise.
        Returns:
        Is the board rotated?
        Since:
        1.1.08
        See Also:
        isScaled()

      • updateMode

        public void updateMode()
        update the type of interaction mode, and trigger a repaint. Also calls updateHoverTipToMode() and (for 6-player board's Special Building Phase) updates top-center text. For Game Option "N7", updates the top-center countdown of rounds from SOCGame.getRoundCount(). For the Free Placement debug mode, indicates that in the top center.

      • updateHoverTipToMode

        protected void updateHoverTipToMode()
        Update hoverTip based on mode when it changes; called from updateMode(). Might or might not repaint board: Calls SOCBoardPanel.BoardToolTip.setOffsetX(int) or SOCBoardPanel.BoardToolTip.setHoverText(String, int).
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • clearModeAndHilight

        protected void clearModeAndHilight(int ptype)
        Set board mode to NONE, no hilight, usually from a piece-placement mode. Calls updateHoverTipToMode() and repaints the board.
        Parameters:
        ptype - Piece type to clear, like SOCPlayingPiece.ROAD, or -1 for robber. Used to avoid race condition during initial placement, where server has already replied with mode for another piece type, and board has already set mode to place that piece type. If ptype doesn't match the board's current mode/piece type, board's mode is not changed to NONE.
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • popupExpectingBuildRequest

        public boolean popupExpectingBuildRequest()

        Since:

      • popupSetBuildRequest

        public void popupSetBuildRequest(int coord,
                                 int ptype)
        Since player has chosen a piece to build from the right-click popup menu, set fields to expect a placing GameState reply from server. In case server doesn't reply, starts a timer to eventually send the build-piece request regardless, after canceling any previous timer.

        Does not send the initial build-type request; caller should do so afterwards with SOCBuildingPanel.clickBuildingButton(SOCGame, String, boolean).

        To cancel this new pending build request, call popupClearBuildRequest().

        When client receives the expected GameState from server, other client code will respond by calling popupFireBuildingRequest().

        Parameters:
        coord - Piece's edge or node coordinate
        ptype - Piece type, like SOCPlayingPiece.ROAD
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        popupExpectingBuildRequest()

      • popupClearBuildRequest

        public void popupClearBuildRequest()
        player decided to not build something, so cancel the TimerTask that's waiting to tell the server what they wanted to build.
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • popupFireBuildingRequest

        public void popupFireBuildingRequest()
        Client has received gamestate placing message; send the building request in reply.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        popupSetBuildRequest(int, int)

      • setSuperimposedText

        public void setSuperimposedText(java.lang.String text1,
                                java.lang.String text2)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Text to be displayed as 2 lines superimposed over the center of the board graphic (during game setup). Either text2, or both, can be null to display nothing. Keep the text short, because boardPanel may not be very wide (PANELX pixels). Will trigger a repaint.
        Parameters:
        text1 - Line 1 (or only line) of text, or null
        text2 - Line 2 of text, or null; must be null if text1 is null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if text1 null, text2 non-null

        1.1.07

      • setModeMoveShip

        public void setModeMoveShip(int edge)
        Set the interaction mode to "move ship"; the player must now click where they want the ship to be moved. Repaints the board immediately.
        Parameters:
        edge - Edge coordinate of our player's ship we're moving. Not checked for validity.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        tryMoveShipToEdge()

      • reloadBoardGraphics

        static void reloadBoardGraphics(java.awt.Component c)
        Flush and reload the set of hex graphics currently selected in user preference SOCPlayerClient.PREF_HEX_GRAPHICS_SET.

        Note: Afterwards, you must call each current instance's flushBoardLayoutAndRepaint().

        Parameters:
        c - Any SOCBoardPanel or other UI component packaged in the same jar, to load image resource files with getToolkit and getResource
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • hexColor

        public final java.awt.Color hexColor(int hexType)
        Hex color for a hex resource type
        Parameters:
        hexType - hexType value, as in SOCBoard.DESERT_HEX, SOCBoard.WOOD_HEX, SOCBoard.WATER_HEX. Same value and meaning as those in SOCBoard.getHexTypeFromCoord(int)
        Returns:
        The corresponding color from ColorSquare, or ColorSquare.WATER if hexType not recognized.
        Since:
        1.1.07
